alert.note: Alert for Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Rutland and Windsor Counties in Vermont, especially near the towns of Tyson, Plymouth, and Bridgewater. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 654 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodstock, Plymouth, Reading, Ludlow Village, Cavendish, Ludlow, Bridgewater, Mount Holly, Camp Plymouth State Park, Camp Plymouth, Tyson, Calvin Coolidge State Park, Coolidge State Park, South Reading, Plymouth Union and Bridgewater Corners. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
